title: Removes certain technical provisions related to air-borne emergency transit
summary: Removes certain technical provisions related to air-borne emergency transit to the hospital.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          406

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CROUCH -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to removing certain tech-
         nical provisions related to air-borne emergency transit

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph (A) of  paragraph  5  of  subsection  (aa)  of
    2  section  4303  of the insurance law, as added by chapter 506 of the laws
    3  of 2001, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (A) "Prehospital emergency medical services" means the  prompt  evalu-
    5  ation  and treatment of an emergency medical condition, and/or [non-air-
    6  borne] transportation of the patient to a  hospital;  provided  however,
    7  where the patient utilizes non-air-borne emergency transportation pursu-
    8  ant to this subsection, reimbursement will be based on whether a prudent
    9  layperson, possessing an average knowledge of medicine and health, could
   10  reasonably  expect  the  absence of such transportation to result in (i)
   11  placing the health of the person afflicted with such condition in  seri-
   12  ous  jeopardy,  or  in  the  case  of a behavioral condition placing the
   13  health of such person  or  others  in  serious  jeopardy;  (ii)  serious
   14  impairment  to such person's bodily functions; (iii) serious dysfunction
   15  of any bodily organ or part of such person; or (iv)  serious  disfigure-
   16  ment of such person.
   17    S  2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   18  ing the date on which it shall have become  a  law  and  shall  only  be
   19  applicable  to  contracts  issued,  modified or renewed on or after such
   20  effective date.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
